features.name: Minor Impact Feature
features.Description: Traits with limited mechanical impact, more for flavor or roleplay.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A Tiefling’s Infernal Legacy providing the ‘Thaumaturgy’ cantrip.
features.Notes: Enhances role-play without affecting game mechanics significantly.

features.name: Situational Benefit
features.Description: Abilities that are beneficial in specific scenarios but not consistently impactful across various game situations.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Darkvision, advantageous in darkness but not universally applicable.
features.Notes: Useful in certain situations but not universally advantageous.

features.name: Regularly Useful Ability
features.Description: Traits offering consistent utility in various situations.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Elf's Keen Senses granting proficiency in Perception.
features.Notes: Offers clear benefits in many common game scenarios.

features.name: Highly Influential Feature
features.Description: Traits providing significant advantages in a wide range of scenarios.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Gnome's Gnome Cunning providing advantage on all INT, WIS, and CHA saving throws against magic.
features.Notes: Potentially game-altering and should be rare to maintain balance.

features.name: Game-Changing Ability
features.Description: Features that can have a major impact on gameplay and character capabilities.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: The Aarakocra’s flight ability, granting substantial mobility.
features.Notes: Should be rare and carefully balanced with other traits to maintain overall game balance.

features.name: Negative Impact Feature
features.Description: Traits that represent a drawback or challenge for the character.
features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Sunlight Sensitivity found in races like Drow.
features.Notes: These traits add depth and complexity to characters but should be offset by positive traits.

ASI_Features.name: ASI -2
ASI_Features.Description: A significant reduction in an ability score.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A custom race with a drawback in Intelligence for lore reasons.
ASI_Features.Notes: Major drawbacks should be rare and balanced with significant advantages.

ASI_Features.name: ASI -1
ASI_Features.Description: A minor decrease in an ability score, indicating a weakness.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A homebrew race with a slight penalty in Charisma due to its reclusive nature.
ASI_Features.Notes: Minor penalties add depth but should not be overly penalizing.

ASI_Features.name: ASI +1
ASI_Features.Description: A moderate increase in an ability score.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A custom race designed for agility, with a +1 bonus to Dexterity.
ASI_Features.Notes: Common among many races, providing a boost without overpowering.

ASI_Features.name: Choice of ASI +1
ASI_Features.Description: Flexibility in choosing which ability score to increase.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A versatile homebrew race allowing a choice of +1 to any ability score.
ASI_Features.Notes: Flexibility in choice makes this more valuable.

ASI_Features.name: ASI +2
ASI_Features.Description: A substantial increase in a key ability score.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race with an affinity for strength, gaining a +2 bonus to Strength.
ASI_Features.Notes: Significant boosts should be carefully balanced with other traits.

ASI_Features.name: ASI +3
ASI_Features.Description: An exceptional boost to a specific ability score.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race exceptionally adept in Wisdom, receiving a +3 bonus.
ASI_Features.Notes: Rare and should be offset by other balancing factors.

ASI_Features.name: ASI +4
ASI_Features.Description: An extraordinary increase in an ability score.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A legendary race deeply connected to magic, with a +4 to Intelligence.
ASI_Features.Notes: Extremely rare and should be carefully considered for balance.

ASI_Features.name: All ASI +1
ASI_Features.Description: A balanced increase across all ability scores.
ASI_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A well-rounded custom race that gets +1 to all ability scores.
ASI_Features.Notes: Offers versatility at the cost of specialization; rare in standard races.

Language_Features.name: Common & 1 language
Language_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Most races with Common and one racial language.
Language_Features.Notes: Basic communication ability, standard for many races.

Language_Features.name: Common & 2 or 3 languages
Language_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race known for its linguistic diversity.
Language_Features.Notes: Slightly more valuable due to added versatility in communication.

Language_Features.name: Choice of Language
Language_Features.Description: Flexibility in choosing an additional language.

Language_Features.name: Speak with small beasts
Language_Features.Description: Ability to communicate with small animals.
Language_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race with a close bond to nature.
Language_Features.Notes: Offers unique role-playing and information-gathering opportunities.

Language_Features.name: 30 foot Telepathy with language barrier
Language_Features.Description: Telepathic communication within a limited range, bypassing language.
Language_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race with innate telepathic abilities.
Language_Features.Notes: Significant advantage in communication, especially in stealth or negotiation scenarios.

Skill_Features.name: Tool (or choice thereof) proficiency
Skill_Features.Description: Proficiency in a specific tool or choice of tool.
Skill_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Dwarves with proficiency in smith's tools.
Skill_Features.Notes: Useful for specific tasks and role-play situations, but generally limited in application.

Skill_Features.name: Skill proficiency
Skill_Features.Notes: Valuable for a wide range of situations, enhancing a key aspect of character capability.

Skill_Features.name: Choice of Skill Proficiency
Skill_Features.Description: Flexibility in choosing which skill to be proficient in.
Skill_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Half-Elves with the choice of any skill.
Skill_Features.Notes: The flexibility of choice adds significant value.

Skill_Features.name: Choice of Two Skill Proficiencies
Skill_Features.Description: Choice of two skills to gain proficiency in.
Skill_Features.Notes: Greatly enhances versatility and adaptability of the character.

Skill_Features.name: Expertise on rare subset of a skill
Skill_Features.Description: Expertise in a rare or less commonly used subset of a skill.
Skill_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Bards with expertise in a specific instrument.
Skill_Features.Notes: Niche but can be highly effective in the right context.

Skill_Features.name: Expertise on subset of a skill
Skill_Features.Description: Expertise in a more commonly used subset of a skill.
Skill_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Rogues with expertise in Stealth or Thieves' Tools.
Skill_Features.Notes: Provides a significant advantage in specific areas.

Skill_Features.name: Skill Proficiency and Expertise
Skill_Features.Description: Combination of skill proficiency and expertise in that skill.
Skill_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Bards with expertise in a chosen skill.
Skill_Features.Notes: Offers a substantial advantage in the chosen skill area.

Magic_Features.name: Cantrip
Magic_Features.Description: Gain one cantrip from a specific spell list.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: High Elves' ability to learn one wizard cantrip.
Magic_Features.Notes: Provides a magical ability usable at will, enhancing versatility.

Magic_Features.name: Choice of Cantrip
Magic_Features.Description: Choose one cantrip from a specified list.
Magic_Features.Notes: The freedom to choose a cantrip adds extra value.

Magic_Features.name: Spellcasting (1st Level) at 3rd Level, 1/day
Magic_Features.Description: Cast a 1st-level spell once per day at 3rd level.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Drow's 'Drow Magic' trait allowing them to cast 'Faerie Fire' at 3rd level.
Magic_Features.Notes: Access to spellcasting, even if limited, provides significant utility.

Magic_Features.name: Spellcasting (2nd Level) at 3rd Level, 1/day
Magic_Features.Description: Cast a 2nd-level spell once per day at 3rd level.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A homebrew race with the ability to cast a 2nd-level spell once per day.
Magic_Features.Notes: Higher level spells offer greater utility and power.

Magic_Features.name: Spellcasting (1st Level) 1/day
Magic_Features.Description: Cast a 1st-level spell once per day.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Genasi's 'Elemental Gift' allowing casting of a spell like 'Levitate' once per day.
Magic_Features.Notes: Daily spellcasting, even at 1st level, can be a game-changer in many scenarios.

Magic_Features.name: Spellcasting (2nd Level) 1/day
Magic_Features.Description: Cast a 2nd-level spell once per day.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: A custom race with the ability to cast a 2nd-level spell daily.
Magic_Features.Notes: Offers more powerful magical options on a daily basis.

Magic_Features.name: Choice of Spell (1/day)
Magic_Features.Description: Choose a spell to cast once per day from a specified list.
Magic_Features.Example_in_DnD_5e: Triton's 'Guardians of the Depths' trait allowing them to cast 'Fog Cloud' or 'Gust of Wind'.
Magic_Features.Notes: The choice adds versatility, making this trait more valuable.

Magic_Features.name: Innate Spellcasting (3rd Level)
Magic_Features.Description: Innate ability to cast a 3rd-level spell once per day.
Magic_Features.Notes: Access to a higher-level spell on a daily basis significantly enhances a character's abilities.

Resistances.name: One Rare Resistance
Resistances.Description: Resistance to a damage type that is rarely encountered.
Resistances.Notes: Valuable in specific scenarios; rarity of the damage type considered in the value.

Resistances.name: One Medium Resistance
Resistances.Description: Resistance to a damage type that is moderately common.
Resistances.Notes: Provides significant advantage in many combat situations.

Resistances.name: One Common Resistance
Resistances.Description: Resistance to a damage type frequently encountered in the game.
Resistances.Example_in_DnD_5e: Resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks.
Resistances.Notes: Highly beneficial due to the commonality of the damage type.

Resistances.name: One Nonmagical Physical Resistance
Resistances.Description: Resistance to one of the physical damage types (bludgeoning, piercing, slashing) from nonmagical attacks.
Resistances.Example_in_DnD_5e: Resistance to slashing from nonmagical attacks.
Resistances.Notes: Extremely valuable in combat due to the frequency of physical attacks in most campaigns.

Vulnerabilities.name: One Rare Vulnerability
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability to a damage type that is rarely encountered.
Vulnerabilities.Notes: Major drawback but less impactful due to the rarity of the damage type.

Vulnerabilities.name: One Medium Vulnerability
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability to a damage type that is moderately common.
Vulnerabilities.Notes: Significantly increases the danger in many combat scenarios due to the moderate frequency of the damage type.

Vulnerabilities.name: One Common Vulnerability
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability to a damage type frequently encountered in the game.
Vulnerabilities.Notes: Highly detrimental due to the commonality of the damage type in combat.

Vulnerabilities.name: One Physical Vulnerability
Vulnerabilities.Description: Vulnerability to one of the physical damage types (bludgeoning, piercing, slashing).
Vulnerabilities.Notes: Extremely hazardous in combat due to the frequency of physical attacks in most campaigns.

Movement.name: 20 ft speed
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race with naturally slower movement.
Movement.Notes: Impacts mobility significantly, potentially hindering exploration and positioning in combat.

Movement.name: 25 ft speed
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: Dwarves and Halflings with a 25 ft speed.
Movement.Notes: Minor impact on mobility; can affect tactical movement in combat and exploration.

Movement.name: 30 ft speed
Movement.Description: Average base walking speed for most races.
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: Humans and Elves with a 30 ft speed.
Movement.Notes: Standard movement speed, no additional value or drawback.

Movement.name: 35 ft speed
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: Wood Elves with a 35 ft speed.
Movement.Notes: Provides a tactical advantage in various situations, particularly in combat and exploration.

Movement.name: 40 ft speed
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race known for its swiftness.
Movement.Notes: Offers notable tactical and exploratory advantages.

Movement.name: 30 ft climb speed
Movement.Description: Ability to climb at a speed of 30 feet.
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race adept at climbing, like Tabaxi.
Movement.Notes: Enhances mobility in vertical environments, offering unique tactical options.

Movement.name: Spider Climb
Movement.Description: Ability to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down.
Movement.Notes: Provides significant exploration and combat advantages in environments with climbable surfaces.

Movement.name: 30 ft swim speed
Movement.Description: Ability to swim at a speed of 30 feet.
Movement.Notes: Enhances mobility in aquatic environments, useful in specific scenarios.

Movement.name: Feline Agility
Movement.Description: Temporary boost to speed under certain conditions.
Movement.Notes: Offers a burst of speed, beneficial in both combat and exploration.

Movement.name: Aggressive
Movement.Description: Ability to move towards an enemy as a bonus action.
Movement.Notes: Useful for closing distances in combat, enhancing offensive capabilities.

Movement.name: Not Slowed by Armor
Movement.Description: Ability to maintain speed despite wearing heavier armor.
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: Dwarves' speed not reduced by heavy armor.
Movement.Notes: Allows for tactical flexibility in armor choice without sacrificing mobility.

Movement.name: Ignore Rare type of Rough Terrain
Movement.Description: Ability to move through specific types of difficult terrain.
Movement.Notes: Useful in certain environmental conditions, providing a situational advantage.

Movement.name: Ignore Common type of Rough Terrain
Movement.Description: Ability to move through commonly encountered difficult terrain.
Movement.Notes: More broadly applicable than rare terrain adaptions, offering frequent utility.

Movement.name: Ignore non-magical Rough Terrain
Movement.Description: Unhindered movement through all non-magical difficult terrain.
Movement.Example_in_DnD_5e: A race exceptionally adept at traversing rough terrain.
Movement.Notes: Provides a significant advantage in many exploration and combat scenarios.

Flight.name: Standard Fly 30
Flight.Notes: Provides significant tactical and exploration advantages, especially in open environments.

Flight.name: Hover
Flight.Description: Ability to hover in place while flying.
Flight.Notes: Adds versatility to flying, useful in combat and specific scenarios.

Flight.name: Plus 5 ft fly speed
Flight.Description: Incremental increase in flying speed by 5 feet.
Flight.Notes: Minor improvement over standard flying speeds.

Flight.name: Plus 10 ft fly speed
Flight.Description: Incremental increase in flying speed by 10 feet.
Flight.Notes: Notable improvement over standard flying speeds.

Flight.name: Always On Feather Fall
Flight.Description: Innate ability resembling the 'Feather Fall' spell.
Flight.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with inherent slow fall ability.
Flight.Notes: Provides a significant safety net against falling.

Flight.name: Must land at End of Turn
Flight.Description: Requirement to land at the end of each turn when flying.
Flight.Notes: Limits the utility of flight in prolonged aerial situations.

Flight.name: Unrestricted Fly 30
Flight.Notes: Offers substantial freedom and tactical advantage in movement.

Senses.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Senses.Description: Disadvantage in sunlight on sight-based checks.
Senses.Notes: Major drawback in bright environments, impacting combat and perception.

Senses.name: Darkvision 30
Senses.Notes: Useful in low-light conditions, less effective than standard Darkvision.

Senses.name: Darkvision +60
Senses.Description: Extended range for Darkvision, up to 60 feet.
Senses.Notes: Standard Darkvision range, beneficial in darkness.

Senses.name: Darkvision 120
Senses.Notes: Enhanced range, very useful in darkness.

Senses.name: Blindsight to 30ft
Senses.Notes: Provides significant advantage in detecting creatures and objects without relying on sight.

Senses.name: Blindsight to 30ft, blind beyond
Senses.Description: Blindsight up to 30 feet, but cannot see beyond.
Senses.Notes: Useful in close quarters but limiting for long-range perception.

Advantages.name: Advantage on a rare roll
Advantages.Description: Advantage on checks or saves that rarely occur.
Advantages.Notes: Useful in specific scenarios, but limited due to rarity.

Advantages.name: Advantage on a situational roll
Advantages.Description: Advantage on checks or saves in certain situations.
Advantages.Example_in_DnD_5e: Advantage in favored terrain or condition.
Advantages.Notes: More broadly applicable than rare rolls, offering moderate utility.

Advantages.name: Advantage on a common roll
Advantages.Description: Advantage on frequently occurring checks or saves.
Advantages.Notes: Highly beneficial in regularly encountered situations.

Advantages.name: Advantage on a very common roll or set of rolls
Advantages.Description: Advantage on checks or saves that occur very frequently.
Advantages.Example_in_DnD_5e: Advantage on all checks related to a key ability.
Advantages.Notes: Extremely useful, impacting a wide range of common gameplay situations.

Weapons.name: Weapon Training
Weapons.Description: Proficiency with a specific category of weapons.
Weapons.Example_in_DnD_5e: Dwarves with proficiency in axes and hammers.
Weapons.Notes: Useful for specific combat styles, adding versatility but not overpowering.

Weapons.name: 2 Simple Weapons of Choice
Weapons.Description: Choose proficiency with any two simple weapons.
Weapons.Notes: Provides flexibility in weapon choice, beneficial for certain roles.

Weapons.name: 2 Martial Weapons of Choice
Weapons.Description: Choose proficiency with any two martial weapons.
Weapons.Notes: More valuable than simple weapon proficiency, offering access to more powerful weapons.

Unarmed_Strikes.name: 1d4 unarmed strike
Unarmed_Strikes.Notes: Enhances unarmed combat effectiveness, useful for certain classes or in specific scenarios.

Unarmed_Strikes.name: 1d6 unarmed strike
Unarmed_Strikes.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with stronger unarmed combat capabilities.
Unarmed_Strikes.Notes: Provides a significant advantage in unarmed combat situations.

Unarmed_Strikes.name: 1d8 unarmed strike
Unarmed_Strikes.Example_in_DnD_5e: Homebrew races with powerful natural weapons.
Unarmed_Strikes.Notes: Considerable damage for unarmed strikes, useful in many combat scenarios.

Natural_Weapons.name: 1d4 natural weapon
Natural_Weapons.Notes: Provides an alternative to unarmed strikes, useful in specific combat scenarios.

Natural_Weapons.name: 1d6 natural weapon
Natural_Weapons.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with more potent natural attacks.
Natural_Weapons.Notes: Stronger than standard unarmed strikes, offering a combat advantage.

Natural_Weapons.name: 1d8 natural weapon
Natural_Weapons.Example_in_DnD_5e: Homebrew races with powerful natural attacks.
Natural_Weapons.Notes: Significant damage for natural weapons, enhancing combat capabilities.

Natural_Weapons.name: 1d10 natural weapon
Natural_Weapons.Notes: High damage output for natural weapons, ideal for combat-focused characters or creatures.

Breathing.name: Hold Breath 15 mins
Breathing.Description: Ability to hold breath for 15 minutes.
Breathing.Notes: Useful in specific scenarios, particularly in aquatic adventures.

Breathing.name: Amphibious
Breathing.Description: Ability to breathe air and water.
Breathing.Notes: Offers significant advantages in campaigns with underwater components.

Breathing.name: Unending Breath
Breathing.Description: Ability to breathe indefinitely without air.
Breathing.Notes: Useful in certain niche scenarios, offering unique exploration and survival capabilities.

Breathing.name: Doesn't breath
Breathing.Notes: Offers immunity to effects targeting the respiratory system, useful in specific scenarios.

Natural_Armor.name: 11+Dex armor
Natural_Armor.Description: Natural armor calculation resulting in 11 + Dexterity modifier.
Natural_Armor.Notes: Slightly better than normal unarmored defense, providing a minor boost to AC.

Natural_Armor.name: 12+Dex armor
Natural_Armor.Description: Natural armor calculation resulting in 12 + Dexterity modifier.
Natural_Armor.Notes: Offers a noticeable increase in AC over typical unarmored defense.

Natural_Armor.name: 13+Dex armor
Natural_Armor.Description: Natural armor calculation resulting in 13 + Dexterity modifier.
Natural_Armor.Notes: Comparable to wearing light armor without the need for actual armor.

Natural_Armor.name: AC+1
Natural_Armor.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races or creatures with an innate defense bonus.
Natural_Armor.Notes: Provides a direct and significant increase to defense, beneficial in all combat scenarios.

Size.name: Small
Size.Description: Character size is classified as Small.
Size.Notes: Generally no direct mechanical advantage or disadvantage, but interacts with certain game rules.

Size.name: Powerful Build
Size.Description: Characters count as one size larger for carrying capacity and weight-related considerations.
Size.Notes: Useful for specific tasks involving strength, like lifting, carrying, and grappling.

Size.name: Large (Combat)
Size.Description: Character size is classified as Large in combat situations, affecting space control and grappling.
Size.Notes: Significant impact in combat scenarios, especially for physical presence and control of space.

Size.name: Large (Utility)
Size.Description: Character size is Large for utility purposes, like carrying capacity, without full combat implications.
Size.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with larger stature but not classified as Large in combat.
Size.Notes: Offers advantages in carrying capacity and related tasks, less impact in combat than full Large size.

Racial_Features_1.name: A Type other than Humanoid
Racial_Features_1.Description: Character classified as a creature type other than Humanoid.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Impacts interactions with spells and effects that target specific creature types.

Racial_Features_1.name: Doesn't need to Eat
Racial_Features_1.Description: No requirement for food consumption.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Useful in survival scenarios but limited in direct gameplay impact.

Racial_Features_1.name: Tinker
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to craft small mechanical devices.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Adds versatility and creative options for problem-solving and utility.

Racial_Features_1.name: Acclimatized
Racial_Features_1.Description: Adaptation to specific environmental conditions.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers advantages in certain environments but limited outside those conditions.

Racial_Features_1.name: Healing Hands
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to heal others through a racial trait.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a useful, though limited, healing ability.

Racial_Features_1.name: Fey Ancestry
Racial_Features_1.Description: Advantage against being charmed and immunity to magical sleep.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers significant advantages against certain magical effects.

Racial_Features_1.name: Nimbleness
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to move through spaces of larger creatures.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Enhances mobility in certain situations, particularly in combat and exploration.

Racial_Features_1.name: Trance
Racial_Features_1.Description: Reduced need for sleep and altered resting mechanics.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers advantages in terms of watch schedules and resting, but limited direct combat or exploration impact.

Racial_Features_1.name: Mimicry
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to mimic sounds and voices.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Useful in social interactions and deceptive strategies, though situational.

Racial_Features_1.name: Fury of the Small
Racial_Features_1.Description: Extra damage against larger creatures.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Goblins with Fury of the Small.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a damage boost in combat against larger foes, situational but impactful.

Racial_Features_1.name: Humanoid + Type
Racial_Features_1.Description: Considered both Humanoid and another creature type.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with dual creature type classification.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Can be a drawback as it opens up vulnerabilities to more types of effects.

Racial_Features_1.name: Mask of the Wild
Racial_Features_1.Description: Enhanced ability to hide in natural settings.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Wood Elves with Mask of the Wild.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Useful for stealth and ambush strategies, especially in natural environments.

Racial_Features_1.name: Savage Attacks
Racial_Features_1.Description: Extra damage dice on critical hits.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Increases combat effectiveness, particularly in delivering critical hits.

Racial_Features_1.name: Reach
Racial_Features_1.Description: Increased reach for melee attacks.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Significant advantage in melee combat, affecting engagement range.

Racial_Features_1.name: Armor Training (Light)
Racial_Features_1.Description: Proficiency with light armor.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with inherent light armor proficiency.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Useful for classes that don't start with this proficiency, adding versatility in armor choices.

Racial_Features_1.name: Armor Training (Light and Medium)
Racial_Features_1.Description: Proficiency with light and medium armor.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: More valuable than light armor proficiency alone, offering greater protection options.

Racial_Features_1.name: Poison Resistance and Advantage
Racial_Features_1.Description: Resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against poison.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers considerable protection against a common hazard in D&D.

Racial_Features_1.name: Naturally Stealthy
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to attempt to hide when obscured by larger creatures.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Beneficial for stealthy characters, providing more options for hiding.

Racial_Features_1.name: Relentless Endurance
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to avoid dropping to 0 hit points once per long rest.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a significant survivability boost in combat.

Racial_Features_1.name: Lucky
Racial_Features_1.Description: Reroll certain dice rolls a limited number of times per day.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers a strong advantage in key moments, affecting various rolls.

Racial_Features_1.name: Toughness
Racial_Features_1.Description: Increased hit points.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with inherent toughness or durability.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Directly increases survivability by boosting hit points.

Racial_Features_1.name: Stone's Endurance
Racial_Features_1.Description: Reduce damage taken as a reaction.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers a significant one-time damage mitigation per rest, useful in combat.

Racial_Features_1.name: Breath Weapon
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to exhale destructive energy, typically once per rest.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides an additional combat option with area effect, versatile and impactful.

Racial_Features_1.name: Nimble Escape
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to Disengage or Hide as a bonus action.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Enhances mobility and tactical options in combat, especially for hit-and-run tactics.

Racial_Features_1.name: Gnome Cunning
Racial_Features_1.Description: Advantage on all intelligence, wisdom, and charisma saving throws against magic.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers substantial protection against a wide range of magical effects.

Racial_Features_1.name: Aasimar Transformation
Racial_Features_1.Description: Access to powerful transformation abilities.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Grants significant combat or utility abilities, impactful in various scenarios.

Racial_Features_1.name: Pack Tactics
Racial_Features_1.Description: Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the Aasimar's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a consistent combat advantage in group situations.

Racial_Features_1.name: Choice of Feat
Racial_Features_1.Description: Ability to select a feat at character creation.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Grants significant flexibility and power, allowing customization of character abilities.

Racial_Features_1.name: Advantage against diseases
Racial_Features_1.Description: Advantage on saving throws against diseases.
Racial_Features_1.Example_in_DnD_5e: Races with strong constitutions or magical resistance.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Useful in campaigns where disease is a frequent hazard, but situational.

Racial_Features_1.name: Magic Resistance
Racial_Features_1.Description: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a broad and powerful defense against a wide array of magical threats.

Racial_Features_1.name: Fills rests with light activity instead of sleep
Racial_Features_1.Description: Less need for traditional sleep, replaced by light activity.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Offers advantages in terms of watch schedules and resting, but limited direct combat or exploration impact.

Racial_Features_1.name: Yuan-ti Standard Delayed Magic
Racial_Features_1.Description: Access to innate spellcasting abilities, typically available at higher levels.
Racial_Features_1.Notes: Provides a range of magical options, enhancing versatility and utility.
